Package com.github.actionfx.core

Class ActionFX

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.ActionFX
  • public class ActionFX
extends java.lang.Object
    Central handler for working with ActionFX. It provides routines to get views and controllers.

    As ActionFX uses an internal bean container with dependency injection support, it is recommended to wire all controllers with @Inject instead of accessing them through this class (please note that there is also support of Spring's bean container through ActionFX's afx-spring-boot module).

    Using ActionFX:

    Before using this class, it needs to be setup in the main() or Application.init() method for the specific application.

    Expample: ActionFX actionFX = ActionFX.builder().configurationClass(SampleApp.class).build(); 

     
    
 After the setup, an instance of this class is retrieved throughout the application via:

 
     ActionFX instance = ActionFX.getInstance();
 
    
 
    
 After the ActionFX instance is built, a component scan can be performed:

 
     ActionFX.getInstance().scanForActionFXComponents();
 
    

 This will populate ActionFX internal bean container and makes controller and
 views available for usage. Please note, that this step is not required, if
 you use Spring Boot and included module afx-spring-boot in your
 application classpath. The afx-spring-boot provides
 auto-configuration and scans for ActionFX components with its Spring bean
 container during start-up.
 
    
 In case you need access to the ActionFX instance in a controller, you can
 alternatively inject the ActionFX instance via Inject. This might be
 helpful for unit testing your controller independently of a setup ActionFX
 instance (you can use e.g. Mockito to mock the ActionFX instance for
 unit-testing).

 
     @AFXController(viewId="mainView", fxml="some.fxml">
 public class MainController {

 @Inject
 private ActionFX actionFX;

 }
    Author:
    koster

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static ActionFX.ActionFXBuilder builder()
        Creates a builder that is used for setting up the application-specific instance of ActionFX.
        Returns:
        the ActionFX builder instance that is used to setup the configuration

      • getInstance

        public static ActionFX getInstance()
        Gets an instance of ActionFX. Before calling this method, you need to setup your application-specific configuration that ActionFX shall handle by using the #build() method, returning an instance of ActionFX.ActionFXBuilder.
        Returns:

      • scanForActionFXComponents

        public void scanForActionFXComponents()
        Scans for ActionFX components, depending on the configured scanPackage. In case an alternative bean container shall be used for ActionFX, please use scanForActionFXComponents(BeanContainerFacade) instead of this method.

      • scanForActionFXComponents

        public void scanForActionFXComponents​(BeanContainerFacade beanContainer)
        Scans for ActionFX components, depending on the configured scanPackage. This routine allows to specify an alternative BeanContainerFacade to use, instead of the internal DefaultBeanContainer. The definition of the BeanContainerFacade type is not part of the ActionFX configuration, because the configuration and setup is performed at the soonest possible time in the application, preferable in the main() method of the Application. The bean container implementation (e.g. when using Spring as bean container) is not yet setup at this point in time!
        Parameters:
        beanContainer - the

      • getView

        public View getView​(java.lang.String viewId)
        Gets the view by the supplied viewId.
        Parameters:
        viewId - the view ID
        Returns:
        the view instance. If the viewId does not exists, null is returned.

      • getController

        public <T> T getController​(java.lang.Class<T> controllerClass)
        Gets the controller defined by the supplied controllerClass.
        Parameters:
        controllerClass - the controller class for that a controller instance shall be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the retrieved controller instance.If the controllerClass does not exists, null is returned.

        Returns:

      • setPrimaryStage

        public void setPrimaryStage​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Users can set the primary stage here so that it is available throughout the application.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - the primary stage

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets ActionFX to its initial state. Can be used in unit test. Use this method in productive code only when you know exactly what you are doing.
